;;2019 年布兰妮·斯皮尔斯。
;

;;布兰妮·斯皮尔斯;在她即将出版的回忆录《我心中的女人》中透露了有关她在 2007 年和 2008 年崩溃的更多细节。

;

;斯皮尔斯写道，在她的几次公开事件中——包括剃光头和袭击狗仔队的汽车——她患有产后抑郁症、姨妈去世后的悲伤以及与前夫凯文·费德林的监护权之争。

;

;“我剃光头后，每个人都害怕我，甚至是我妈妈，”她写道。 “在没有孩子的那几个星期里，我一次又一次地失去了它。”她形容自己“悲痛欲绝”。

;

;这些事件导致了 2008 年备受争议的监护权，即法院下令的监护权。法院裁定，她的父亲詹姆斯·“杰米”·斯皮尔斯 (James “Jamie” Spears) 和律师安德鲁·M·沃利特 (Andrew M Wallet) 将掌控她的个人生活、日程安排、财务、职业和财产。

;

;斯皮尔斯写道：“我愿意承认，在严重产后抑郁症的痛苦中，被丈夫遗弃、与两个孩子分离的折磨、我敬爱的桑德拉阿姨的去世以及狗仔队不断的压力，我开始在某些方面像个孩子一样思考。”

; <图 data-media-id="b011c1cfd9d50397f1a4b761e45ce098d1e97eb7">; ; ;

;摘录由 ;《纽约时报》;，记者在《我体内的女人》出版前获得了一份副本计划于周二发布。

;

;在斯皮尔斯多次公开出庭后，备受争议的法律监管于 2021 年 11 月终止，导致她的父亲和律师被解除作为她的法律决策者的职务。

;

; p>;

;;#FreeBritney; 运动，这是一场由粉丝主导的运动，旨在结束她的监护权，斯皮尔斯的父亲称之为“阴谋论者”发起的“笑话”。

;

;她忍受了监护权她写道，这是为了能接触到她的两个年幼的儿子。 “被压在轮床上后，我知道他们可以随时束缚我的身体。所以我就同意了……我的自由换取了和孩子们一起午睡——这是我愿意做的交易。”

;

;斯皮尔斯的回忆录扩展了法庭案件期间播出的对她父亲的批评。她指责他只是为了她的经济潜力而看她，并表示：“我开始认为他把我放在地球上只是为了帮助他们的现金流。”

;

;她描述了她所经历的监护权的矛盾：被视为“病得太重，无法选择自己的男朋友，但不知怎的，身体却足够健康，可以出现在情景喜剧和早间节目中，并且每周可以在世界不同地区为成千上万的人表演” .

;

;斯皮尔斯说，监管条款不公平且具有控制性，他写道：“我知道我一直表现得很疯狂，但我所做的一切都没有证明他们对待我就像我是一家银行一样回忆录还批评了媒体对她在 2000 年代中期参加派对的描述，当时她经常被拍到与林赛·罗韩 (Lindsay Lohan) 和帕丽斯·希尔顿 (Paris Hilton) 等朋友晚上出去玩。

; <图data-media-id="2916f77f67fd9d176491f11bcb99cf00d60ae375">; ; ; < /figure>;

;她写道，与报道相反，她“从未”对毒品或酒精上瘾，但会服用 ADHD 药物阿得拉 (Adderall)。她写道，“它让我兴奋，是的，但更吸引我的是它让我在几个小时内感觉不那么沮丧”。

;

;在其他地方，她解释了她如何与歌手贾斯汀·汀布莱克，但表示她;和他在一起时堕胎了;，因为他说他们太年轻了，不能生孩子。她写道，在恋爱期间，媒体对她身体的淫荡以及公众的批评，导致她开始服用百忧解。

;

;斯皮尔斯写道，作为“身体和情感伤害”的一部分，她患有持续的偏头痛。她仍然经历着监管解散后的经历：“我认为我的家人并不理解他们所造成的真正损害。”

;

;她补充说，她不想重返音乐创作。 “目前我的重点不是推进我的音乐事业，”她写道。 “是时候让我不再成为别人想要的人了；是时候真正找到自己了。”

; Fri, 20 Oct 2023 00:52:01 +0800 Silvio Berlusconi heirs weigh up fate of his mostly worthless art collectionhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/19/silvio-berlusconi-heirs-weigh-up-fate-of-his-mostly-worthless-art-collection
;;2023-10-19T16:17:03Z;
;
;;西尔维奥·贝卢斯科尼收藏中的一些画作
;

;西尔维奥·贝卢斯科尼的继承人从他的遗产中继承了数十亿美元但现在他们面临着一个两难的境地：如何处理他收藏的大量几乎毫无价值的艺术品，其中包括裸体妇女和麦当娜的画作，这些艺术品存放在米兰附近他家对面的仓库里。

;

;前者总理，;于 6 月去世;据报道，86 岁高龄的他在生命的最后几年收集了 25,000 件作品，其中大部分是从深夜购物渠道购买的，以求成为顶级收藏家。

;

;维托里奥·斯加尔比 (Vittorio Sgarbi)，国家博物馆副部长文化部、艺术评论家和贝卢斯科尼的密友表示，由于“不眠之夜”，人们从 2018 年开始就开始强迫性地购买通过电视拍卖出售的艺术品。

;

;他告诉《报告》，该调查系列节目播出在 Rai 上，贝卢斯科尼估计花费了 2000 万欧元购买 Sgarbi 所说的一系列“硬壳”，重点似乎是数量而不是质量。

; ;

;据《共和报》报道，这些藏品对贝卢斯科尼的五个后代来说是一种负担，尤其是因为它每年花费 80 万欧元来维护圣马蒂诺别墅对面的巨大仓库，这是他在米兰附近的阿尔科雷的主要住所，里面存放着作品。

;

;在贝卢斯科尼访问期间，第一批接到贝卢斯科尼电话的专家之一。深夜电视拍卖的负责人是卢卡斯·维亚尼尼 (Lucas Vianini)，他后来成为这位亿万富翁的首席策展人。

;

;“2018 年，接线员告诉我贝卢斯科尼打来电话，”维亚尼尼告诉《报告》。维亚尼尼后来被邀请到圣马蒂诺别墅。 “我首先看到的是 Dudu（一只狗），然后贝卢斯科尼出现了，”他说。

;

;维亚尼尼说，他策划的画作包括风景画以及描绘贝卢斯科尼最喜欢的城市米兰和巴黎的画作。在描述圣马蒂诺别墅对面的仓库时，维亚尼尼说：“贝卢斯科尼喜欢一切井然有序……这不是一个仓库，它更像是一家精品店。”

;

;据了解，贝卢斯科尼的仓库里有许多物品。数百幅宗教人物画作来自那不勒斯附近的一家商人纽瓦特画廊。店主朱塞佩·德格雷戈里奥 (Giuseppe De Gregorio) 告诉《报告》，当他接到贝卢斯科尼的电话询问一幅价值 150 欧元的画时，他简直不敢相信。

;

;“他说：‘我要它！’ ，”德格雷戈里奥回忆道。两人之间的商业往来和友谊蓬勃发展，德格雷戈里奥送给贝卢斯科尼一尊三米高的政治家大理石雕像作为生日礼物，贝卢斯科尼将其放在仓库中展出的巨大自画像前。

; < 《共和报》报道称，贝卢斯科尼家族正计划拆除这些艺术收藏品，只保留几件被认为最有价值的作品。该报援引斯加尔比的话说：“我不知道这些画作的销毁是否已经开始。” “我确实知道，至少在艺术层面上，这不会构成犯罪。”

;

;贝卢斯科尼留下了一个帝国，其中包括足球俱乐部、房产、游艇和他的主要资产 Mediaset，意大利最大的商业广播公司，价值超过 60 亿欧元，主要归他的孩子们所有。他还向他的合伙人 Marta Fascina 留下了 1 亿欧元，向他的兄弟 Paolo 留下了 1 亿欧元，向意大利力量党前参议员 Marcello Dell'Utri（因与黑手党有联系而入狱）留下了 3000 万欧元。

;

;据信，贝卢斯科尼家族正在考虑将圣马蒂诺别墅 (Villa San Martino) 改造成博物馆，贝卢斯科尼曾在这里举办商业和政治会议以及他的一些著名的“bunga Bunga”派对。

; Fri, 20 Oct 2023 00:22:01 +0800 Man who pretended to be mannequin in Warsaw shop window charged with thefthttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/19/man-who-pretended-to-be-mannequin-in-warsaw-shop-window-charged-with-theft
;;2023-10-19T16:14:18Z;
;
;;华沙服装店里的男子假装是伸手拿包的人体模型
;

;一个男人在波兰华沙，一名男子一动不动地站在一家商店橱窗里，手里拿着一个袋子，希望冒充人体模型，他被指控涉嫌盗窃和入室盗窃。

;

;警方称，这名 22 岁的男子，他们没有透露姓名，但发布了该行为的照片，当他站在橱窗里与人体模型融为一体时，工作人员和购物者没有注意到他。

;

;他被指控进入各个部门并采取行动关门时间后的珠宝。

;

;“他手里拿着一个袋子，一动不动地站在商店橱窗前，假装是一个展示人体模型，”华沙市中心斯罗德米斯切区的警方在一份声明中说。 “当他感到安全时，他去打猎并抢劫了岛上的珠宝。”

;

;该男子还被指控犯有其他购物中心事件。据称，另一天，他在关门后去了一家购物中心的酒吧，“吃饱了”，然后进入一家名牌服装店“换新衣服”，并在另一家酒吧停下来吃饭。闭路电视拍到他从商店百叶窗的一个小缝隙中滑行。

;

;在另一起事件中，据称他等到打烊时间才从几台收银机中取钱，并试图偷窃物品。

;

;但最终，警方表示，当他被发现并被保安拘留时，“他的运气终于耗尽了”。该男子已被还押三个月，并面临最高 10 年的监禁。

; Fri, 20 Oct 2023 00:22:01 +0800 Science adviser referred to Rishi Sunak as ‘Dr Death’, Covid inquiry hearshttps://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2023/oct/19/science-adviser-referred-to-rishi-sunak-as-dr-death-covid-inquiry-hears
;;2023-10-19T15:28:10Z;
;
;;2020 年 8 月伦敦唐人街一家餐厅外的“外出就餐，帮忙”标志
;

;据对这一流行病的官方调查获悉，政府首席科学顾问在两人参加的新冠危机会议上发送了一条秘密信息，称里希·苏纳克为“死亡博士”。

;

;安吉拉女爵士教授时任国防部首席科学顾问的麦克莱恩在 WhatsApp 给另一位顶尖科学家的消息中发表了上述评论，显然是指苏纳克在 2020 年夏季实施的“外出就餐助人”计划。< /p>;

;传染病模型教授约翰·埃德蒙兹（John Edmunds）是麦克莱恩信息的接收者，他在调查中表示，他仍然对苏纳克的计划感到愤怒，该计划鼓励人们去餐馆和咖啡馆吃饭，称它发出了错误的信息向公众展示。

; ;

;2020 年 9 月新冠病例开始急剧上升后，今年早些时候麦克莱恩接替他担任政府首席科学顾问的帕特里克·瓦兰斯爵士，责成埃德蒙兹设计可能的方法来遏制这种情况，例如“断路器”封锁或要求人们再次在家工作。

;

;9 月 20 日，瓦兰斯要求埃德蒙兹参加鲍里斯·约翰逊和鲍里斯·约翰逊的会议。苏纳克将听取科学家的意见——“主要来自‘让它撕裂’大队”，瓦兰斯在电子邮件中告诉埃德蒙兹。

;

;麦克莱恩和埃德蒙兹交换了信息，会议上听到了反封锁的声音，麦克莱恩提到“死亡博士总理”。当被问及这是否是指“出去帮忙”时，埃德蒙兹回答说：“那是很久以前的事了，我不知道。但很可能是这样。”

;

;在另一时刻，麦克莱恩问道：“这个混蛋是谁？”埃德蒙兹回答说：“所有统计数据都是错误的。”

;

;当被问及这指谁时，埃德蒙兹告诉调查组：“我很确定这是下一个证人。”在他之后提供证据的是牛津大学循证医学教授 Carl Heneghan，他对多项封锁相关措施持批评态度。

;

;在早期的证据中，埃德蒙兹对苏纳克的计划持高度批评态度，表示虽然不一定会导致感染率恶化，但起到了促使公众承担更多风险的作用。

;

;“说实话，这让我很生气，而且我仍然对此感到愤怒，”他说。 “把脚从刹车上移开是一回事，这就是我们通过放宽限制而一直在做的事情，但在我看来，把脚放在油门上似乎是有悖常理的。”有钱来做这件事——刚刚有 45,000 人死亡。我不想责怪外出就餐来帮助第二波浪潮，因为事实并非如此。但光是看起来就很糟糕。”

;

;他补充道：“我的感觉是，是的，酒吧和餐馆行业确实需要支持，我一点也不反对。但这不仅仅是支持他们。他们本可以给他们钱。这是一个鼓励人们冒流行病学风险的计划。”

;

;Covid-19 Bereaved Families for Justice UK 发言人 Naomi Fulop 表示：“如果不是因为里希·苏纳克（Rishi Sunak）鲁莽、不科学、冷酷无情的做法，我妈妈可能还在我身边。当我们现任的首席科学顾问将我们的总理称为“死亡博士”时，如果另一场大流行来袭，我们怎么能对我们的政府有信心呢？”

; Thu, 19 Oct 2023 23:52:02 +0800 Sunak’s Covid startup fund invested nearly £2m in firms linked to his wifehttps://www.theguardian.com/politics/2023/oct/19/sunaks-covid-startup-fund-invested-nearly-2m-in-firms-linked-to-his-wife
;;2023-10-19T15:00:11Z;
;
;;Akshata Murty 在保守党会议上
;

;Rishi Sunak 在 Covid 大流行期间为支持初创企业而设立的备受争议的基金《卫报》分析发现，他向与其妻子有关联的公司投资了近 200 万英镑。

;

;Akshata Murty 风险投资公司部分拥有的 Carousel Ventures 获得了 100 英镑的投资。据透露，来自未来基金的 25 万美元用于资助其拥有一家名为 Heist Studios 的豪华内衣企业。

;

;据透露，这是与 Murty 有关的第四家获得该基金投资的企业苏纳克在新冠病毒大流行期间担任总理期间为初创公司提供了支持。

;

;穆蒂从未来基金中受益的所有投资都没有公开出现在苏纳克的部长利益登记册上。鉴于苏纳克推出了该计划来帮助初创企业（他的妻子是该领域的知名投资者），批评者对缺乏透明度以及可能存在利益冲突的可能性表示担忧。

;

;Carousel Ventures 的其他投资者通过中介基金，包括现任苏纳克财政部长的保守党议员安德鲁·格里菲斯（Andrew Griffith）和商人布伦特·霍伯曼（Brent Hoberman），他公开恳求苏纳克引入这样一个计划并“拯救我们的初创企业”。

;

;向 Carousel Ventures 提供的 25 万英镑贷款现已转换为股权，因此英国纳税人拥有这家“革命性塑身衣”公司的少量股份。

;

;除了 Carousel Ventures，Murty 还持有 New 的股份。 Craftsmen，获得了25万英镑的未来基金贷款； Mrs Wordsmith，从该基金获得了 130 万英镑；根据基金条款，Digme Fitness 收到了超过 125,000 英镑的未知金额。所有三项业务均进入破产管理程序。

;

;2020 年 5 月，苏纳克推出了未来基金，以在疫情期间帮助新兴企业，但此后一直;受到严厉批评;。

;

;英国商业银行的一位前非执行董事在 2021 年的审计委员会会议上表示，许多未来基金公司充分增长的机会有限，因此将成为“僵尸企业”——无法为自己的业务提供服务。

;

;该计划启动时，业务部门最高级别的公务员需要得到部长级指示（部长们的指示）才能设立该计划，因为它无法确定它是否物有所值。

;

;推出后不久，英国商业银行首席执行官基思·摩根 (Keith Morgan) 向部长们写了一份“保留通知”，警告人们担心该计划将主要吸引无法吸引其他地方投资的“二线”公司，并且为纳税人实现物有所值“高度不确定”。

;

;在获得资金的 1,191 家公司中，约有 130 家已停止在过去三年。

;

;该计划允许任何符合条件的公司获得资金，前提是它们获得了投资者的匹配资金并通过了必要的检查，因此部长们和英国商业银行都无权选择哪些公司获得资金.

;

;No 10 和苏纳克一直认为穆蒂对其投资享有隐私权，并且总理已收到官方建议，他不需要申报这些投资。

;

;部长名册宣称穆蒂拥有 Catamaran Ventures，并且是一名风险资本投资者，拥有大量股权，但没有具体说明。

;

;苏纳克今年早些时候任命的部长利益顾问表示，宣布所有股权持股将是“对部长私人事务的过度干涉，这是不合理的，特别是对其家庭成员而言”。

;

;然而，2023 年 4 月，苏纳克;声明他的妻子持有一家名为 Koru Kids 的儿童保育企业的股份，该企业将受益于预算中引入的一项政策。标准专员还发现，苏纳克在特别委员会被问及此事时应该宣布这一兴趣。

;

;
;;多米尼加美丽的海滩
;

;欧盟对“黄金护照”贸易提出安全担忧”，并在披露五个加勒比国家已向来自伊朗、俄罗斯和中国等国家的 88,000 名个人出售公民身份后誓言加强签证控制。

;

;欧盟委员会周三发布的一份报告首次提出了加勒比护照贸易的真实规模，其中许多国家以每人 100,000 美元（82,326 英镑）起的价格向外国人出售公民身份。

;

;多米尼克是一个人口刚刚超过 70,000 的岛屿，已签发 34,500 份护照，委员会 ;报告;声称。这一数字是多米尼加政府此前披露的总数的四倍多。 St Kitts and Nevis, with a population of 48,000, has issued 36,700 passports, twice as many as ;estimated up to 2018;.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Revealed: thousands who bought 'golden passports' through Dominica's $1bn scheme;

;
;

;Five Caribbean countries – Antigua and Barbuda, Grenada, St Kitts and Nevis, St Lucia and Dominica – have issued 88,000 passports between them.

;

;The announcement follows publication of ;Dominica: Passports of the Caribbean;, an investigation by the Guardian and other media organisations in partnership with the Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project (OCCRP), which examined Dominica's citizenship by investment scheme in unprecedented detail.

;

;The sale of passports in Dominica surged after 2015 when citizens of a number of Caribbean states were given permission to travel to most EU member states for 90 days a year without a visa. St Kitts gained visa-free EU access in 2019.

;

;The Commission is proposing to ;overhaul regulations;, saying it is concerned golden passports could be enabling the “infiltration of organised crime, money laundering, tax evasion and corruption”. The EU has visa-free travel with 60 countries, including small island nations in the Caribbean and Pacific that sell passports.

;

;It says those who acquired a second citizenship were being allowed to change names and identities. Such practices could impede border controls and the enforcement of sanctions or Interpol arrest warrants.

;

;The EU home affairs commissioner, Ylva Johansson, said: “We have countries within the visa-free regime with the EU that are selling passports/citizenships quite cheaply to people that are security risks or potential security risks to the EU.

;

;“They are sometimes allowed to change their names and identity several times after getting the new citizenship, and of course this is also security risks for the EU that we have to look into.”

; ;

;Johansson also raised concerns around migration, telling reporters that 150,000 passengers had used the visa-free travel arrangements to get into the EU and then claim asylum. “This is of course not how the visa-free travelling should be used,” Johansson said.

;

;The report states the rejection rate for applications to Dominica and St Kitts and Nevis “is extremely low (between 3% and 6%), which, together with the short processing times (as little as two months in some cases), raises questions as regards the thoroughness of the security screening”.

;

;It also raised concerns around the nationalities of golden passport holders, saying most applicants came from China and Russia, Syria, Iran, Iraq, Yemen, Nigeria and Libya – all countries that have high levels of perceived corruption.

;

;“Visa-free access to the EU should not be used as a commercial commodity to be sold and bought,” the report stated.

;

;Margaritis Schinas, the European Commission vice-president who is coordinating the migration reforms, said the rules needed “sharpening” with a list of “new reasons to suspend visas”.

;

;Visa-free travel has benefited Europe by increasing tourism and business travel, but it needed “to make sure that our visa policy framework is not misused”, Schinas added.

;

;Dominica has published the names of 7,700 people who received citizenship by investment (as well as other routes such as marriage) between 2009 and 2018. However, ;analysis of budget data; by the Guardian and OCCRP suggested that 19,000 may have become citizens between 2016 and 2022. The EU data suggests that even that estimate was 80% below the true figure.

;

;Dominica has not responded to detailed questions on its scheme. However, the prime minister, Roosevelt Skerrit, defended the sale of passports in two press conferences held after being approached for comment, describing the background checks on applicants as “robust”, with candidates undergoing “layers of due diligence”. He also likened reporters to “terrorists” and arsonists.

;

;Visa-free travel to countries such as the EU and US is one of the key benefits advertised by Caribbean citizenship by investment schemes. Any threat to that privilege could directly impact native-born Dominican citizens, as happened in July when the UK ;withdrew visa-free travel; from its former colony, citing “clear and evident abuse of the scheme, including the granting of citizenship to individuals known to pose a risk to the UK”.

;
;;A bottle of the Macallan 1926 being shown by a man in gloves.
;

;Ava Gardner, Winston Churchill and Mark Twain all understood the importance of a good bottle of whisky.

;

;But even they might balk at the price of a 97-year-old bottle of Macallan to be sold at Sotheby's in London, which the auction house is estimating could fetch £1.2m.

;

;Already the world's most valuable whisky – in 2019, a bottle of Macallan 1926 set a £1.5m record – the bottle being auctioned on 18 November is expected to cause particular excitement.

;

;This bottle is estimated to sell for between £750,000 and £1.2m, meaning a single 25ml shot would be worth between £25,000 and £40,000.

;

;The Adami 1926 is the oldest Macallan vintage ever produced, bottled after being aged in sherry casks for six decades.

;

;Just 40 bottles were produced in 1986 but these were not made available for purchase. Instead, offered to Macallan's top clients, records are broken each time one appears at auction: between 2018 and 2019, the record was broken three times by three of the different variations, Sir Peter Blake, Michael Dillon, and Fine and Rare.

;

;The unique selling point of this particular bottle is that it is the first to have undergone reconditioning by the Macallan distillery, involving the replacement of the capsule and the cork – and a 1ml liquid sample being taken to test against another 1926 bottle at the Edrington offices in Glasgow.

;

;This one Macallan 1926 Adami bottle is now the foundation for all other 1926 bottles that may undergo testing in the future.

;

;“The Macallan 1926 is the one whisky that every auctioneer wants to sell and every collector wants to own,” said Jonny Fowle, Sotheby's global head of spirits. “I am extremely excited to bring a bottle to a Sotheby's auction for the first time since we set the record for this vintage four years ago. Working alongside our friends at the Macallan distillery to recondition and perform clinical analysis on this bottle and liquid has elevated it to an unparalleled status.

;

;“Now, as the bedrock for all Macallan 1926 authenticity and with its condition approved by master distiller Kirsten Campbell, this must surely be the most desirable bottle of whisky ever to come to the market,” he added.

;

;Whether the whisky is ever destined to be drunk – with water, ice or, whisper it, Coke – is unlikely: while one bottle is thought to have been destroyed during a Japanese earthquake in 1911 and another is unaccounted for, just one of the precious 40 bottles has ever knowingly been opened and consumed.

; Thu, 19 Oct 2023 20:52:01 +0800 First asylum seekers return to Bibby Stockholm bargehttps://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2023/oct/19/first-asylum-seekers-return-to-bibby-stockholm-barge
;;2023-10-19T11:53:02Z;
;
;;The Bibby Stockholm in Portland port
;

;Asylum seekers have been forced to return to the ;Bibby Stockholm barge; in Dorset more than two months after it was evacuated following the discovery of legionella bacteria in the water supply.

;

;About 50 local people and campaigners gathered at the gates of Portland port to protest against the men being returned to the facility, but also to welcome them back into their community.

;

;Just Stop Oil protesters briefly caused the coach to stop on its approach.

;

;Some of the men who have returned said they were frightened at the prospect of being made to live on the barge but were concerned that their asylum claims may be rejected if they resisted.

;

;One told the Guardian: “I am worried and afraid. I do not want to go to the barge, but I don't have the courage to disobey. I am literally helpless.

;

;“I don't know what is waiting for me. What will the government's next pilot plans be for the men they are putting on the barge? We feel like pawns in their game, guinea pigs in their experiments. What experiment will they enact on us next? What is at the end of this devastating and crazy wait? Will I be able to save my life and my family?”

;

;It is thought that about 30 men were on a bus that arrived at the port on Thursday lunchtime. Another 45 are believed to be arriving on Friday and Monday.

;

;One of those at the port gates to greet the men, Candy Udwin, of Dorset Stand Up to Racism, said the home secretary, Suella Braverman, was making a political point by forcing them to come back.

;

;She said: “It's not practical. It's going the most expensive asylum seeker accommodation ever with the money they're having to spend on it.”

; ;

;The accommodation, which the government says is part of a package to reduce the £8m-a-day cost of putting up asylum seekers in hotels, has been beset with problems.

;

;Legionella bacteria was discovered onboard the day asylum seekers arrived on 7 August. Concerns were also raised about fire safety and about far-right activity in the area. The barge was evacuated four days after 39 asylum seekers boarded.

;

;Udwin said: “It's not surprising they are scared to return. There are still those who think it is a potential floating Grenfell.” She said in the four days the men were onboard in the summer, some never left it because it was hard to get on and off. “It felt like a prison,” she said.

;

;Members of the Portland Global Friendship Group prepared welcome packs for the men including toiletries, a map of the island, a notebook and a postcard with the group's contact details. They greeted the bus with welcome signs and bunches of flowers.

;

;One of the group members, Heather, said: “The guys have been through so much. It's been so unsettling for them.”

;

;In the four days that the men spent on Portland in August, the group began to make links with them. “I've never met so many educated, skilled, lovely, brave people,” said Heather, who asked that her full name not be used because she had received threats for helping the asylum seekers.

;

;“There are electrical engineers, pharmacists, architects. It's a disgrace we're spending all the money on this but if we processed them quickly and humanely this wouldn't be happening.

;

;“We are a poor community but we are a really kind community and where the government fails, we will stand up. We have so many volunteers – hairdressers offering to give haircuts, teachers offering to give lessons, people with mental health backgrounds. We don't want the barge but they will be part of our community.”

;

;The ;mayor of Portland;, Carralyn Parkes, said: “The whole idea is to be as cruel as possible to deter people from claiming asylum. They are human beings and they are welcome on Portland.”

;

;The bishop of Salisbury, the Rt Rev Stephen Lake, wrote a welcome letter to the men promising a “humane” reception from locals. “Jesus was a refugee and received the care of others,” he said.

;

;When the Bibby arrived in Portland in July, police had to step in after members of a group called ;No to the Barge claimed; that women and children on the island would be put in danger by the men being housed there. No members of the group were present for the men's return.

;

;Only one local man, Danny, said he supported its presence. “We need a deterrent. A five-star hotel isn't a deterrent. And Portland is a safe place. There's little underground crime they [the asylum seekers] could be tempted into,” he said.

;

;Asked why he thought they might be drawn into crime, he said: “These guys are trying to live an illegal way, getting into the country on small boats.”

;

;The Home Office has issued fresh guidance, “;Failure to travel to the Bibby Stockholm vessel;”, saying that support will be terminated for those who “fail to take up the offer of accommodation on the vessel”.
